triples.name: Species diversity
triples.relevance: The paper examines how species diversity affects ecosystem stability, which is the core topic of their investigation.

triples.name: Ecological stability
triples.relevance: Ecological stability is the main property of ecosystems that the paper investigates in relation to diversity.

triples.name: Logistic function
triples.relevance: The paper uses logistic growth as a baseline model to compare against their proposed sublinear growth model.

triples.name: Power law
triples.relevance: The paper proposes sublinear power law growth as a novel model for how population growth scales with biomass.

triples.name: Ontogeny
triples.relevance: The paper uses ontogeny as an analogy to motivate their sublinear growth model for population self-regulation.

triples.name: Population dynamics
triples.relevance: Population dynamics is the underlying mathematical framework used to model competitive interactions between populations.

triples.name: Competition (biology)
triples.relevance: The paper examines how competitive interactions among populations change with different growth models.

triples.name: Macroecology
triples.relevance: The paper predicts large-scale macroecological patterns that can be explained by their sublinear growth model.

triples.name: Biodiversity loss
triples.relevance: The paper predicts that biodiversity loss may accelerate ecosystem destabilization, directly addressing this global challenge.
